Title: Windows Service Control Manager Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Service Control Manager. A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The Service Control Manager (SCM) does not properly verify impersonation levels. A remote authenticated user can run a specially crafted program to gain elevated privileges and make calls to the target SCM that the user does not have privileges to make.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-050

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Bugs Let Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted application to obtain portions of kernel memory on the target system.

WanderingGlitch of HP's Zero Day Initiative reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain portions of kernel memory on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-051

Title: Windows Kernel Memory Address Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can bypass security protections on the target system.
The Windows kernel does not properly validate a memory address. A local user can run a specially crafted application that will bypass Kernel Address Space Layout Randomization (KASLR).

lokihardt@ASRT (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can bypass Address Space Layout Randomization on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-052

Title: (Microsoft Issues Fix for Windows JScript/VBScript Scripting Engine) Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass ASLR and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can bypass security protections on the target system. Windows JScript/VBScript Scripting Engine is affected.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2015-1658, CVE-2015-1684, CVE-2015-1685, CVE-2015-1686, CVE-2015-1688, CVE-2015-1689, CVE-2015-1691, CVE-2015-1692, CVE-2015-1694, CVE-2015-1703, CVE-2015-1704, CVE-2015-1705, CVE-2015-1706, CVE-2015-1708, CVE-2015-1709, CVE-2015-1710, CVE-2015-1711, CVE-2015-1712, CVE-2015-1713, CVE-2015-1714, CVE-2015-1717, CVE-2015-1718]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A remote authenticated user that can exploit a separate vulnerability can gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-1688, CVE-2015-1703, CVE-2015-1704, CVE-2015-1713].

A remote user can bypass address space layout randomization (ASLR) protections [CVE-2015-1684, CVE-2015-1685, CVE-2015-1686].
Impact':
A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can bypass address space layout randomization (ASLR) protections.
Solution:
Microsoft has issued a fix for CVE-2015-1684 and CVE-2015-1686 for Windows JScript/VBScript Script Engine.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-053

Title: Windows Schannel Weak Diffie-Hellman Ephemeral Key Length Lets Remote Users Decrypt TLS Sessions
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Schannel. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user with the ability to monitor network communications can potentially decrypt weak keys when Schannel allows a weak Diffie-Hellman ephemeral (DFE) key length of 512 bits in an encrypted TLS session.
Impact': A remote user can decrypt TLS connections to obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-055

Title: Microsoft Windows OpenType and TrueType Font Parsing Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Windows OpenType and TrueType Font Drivers. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target user's system.
The Windows DirectWrite library does not properly handle OpenType fonts [CVE-2015-1670]. A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user, will access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system.

Mateusz Jurczyk of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2015-1671]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Yichong Lin reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will access potentially sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

[Editor's note: On May 21, 2015, Microsoft updated bulletin MS15-044 to indicate that a new update (3065979) is available to correct an issue that may occur after installing the 3045171 update on Windows 7/Windows 2008 R2 and prior systems.]

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-044

Title: Windows Journal File Processing Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Journal. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted Journal (.jnt) file that, when loaded by the target user with Windows Journal, will trigger an unspecified error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Bill Finlayson of Beyond Trust, Inc., Adith Sudhakar of VMware, Rohit Mothe of VeriSign iDefense Labs, and Steven Seeley of Source Incite reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is provided in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-045

Title: Microsoft Windows Unspecified Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Sysytem Privileges
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to execute a callback to use data from the system token and execute code with System privileges.

Microsoft Windows 8 and later are not affected.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2015/04/probable_apt28_useo.html

FireEye reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-051

Title: Microsoft XML Core Services Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Same-Origin Policy
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML). A remote user can bypass same-origin policy on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted DTD that, when loaded by the target user, will access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system.

Hormazd Billimoria, Xiaoran Wang, Sergey Gorbaty, Anton Rager, and Jonathan Brossard of Salesforce.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass same-origin policy to access potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-039

Title: Windows Kernel Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 2003 R2 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can trigger a flaw in the processing of MS-DOS device names to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2015-1644].

A local user can trigger a type confusion error in NtCreateTransactionManager() to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2015-1643].

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-038

Title: Microsoft Task Scheduler Lets Local Users Gain System Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Task Scheduler. A local user can obtain System privileges on the target system.
Some systems include a known invalid task. A local user can exploit this to cause the task to execute an application on the target system with System privileges.

Renato Ettisberger of IOprotect GmbH reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain System privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-037

Title: Microsoft Graphics Component EMF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Uses Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Graphics Component. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted EMF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Hossein Lotfi, Secunia Research, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-035

Title: Windows HTTP Protocol Stack ('HTTP.sys') Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows 'HTTP.sys'. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to trigger a parsing flaw in the HTTP protocol stack (HTTP.sys) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with System privileges.

The Citrix Security Response Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-034

Title: Windows Kernel Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Windows Registry Virtualization does not properly restrict user access for virtual store modification [CVE-2015-0073]. A local user can run a specially crafted application to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the target user.

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.

Windows does not properly validate and enforce impersonation levels [CVE-2015-0075]. A local user can bypass user account checks to gain elevated privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-025

Title: Microsoft Windows PNG Parsing Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system.
The software does not properly handle uninitialized memory. A remote user can create a specially crafted PNG image file that, when loaded by the target user, will access information on the target user's system.

Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain information from memory on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-024

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Bugs Let Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Driver. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
The kernel-mode driver does not properly initialize function buffers [CVE-2015-0077]. A local user can exploit this to obtain administrative credentials.

The kernel-mode driver does not properly validate the calling thread's token [CVE-2015-0078]. A local user can exploit this to obtain administrative credentials.

The kernel-mode driver discloses private address information during a function call [CVE-2015-0094]. A local user can use this information in conjunction with a separate vulnerability to bypass Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protections.

A local user can trigger a null pointer dereference to obtain kernel memory contents [CVE-2015-0095]. A local user can use this information in conjunction with a separate vulnerability to bypass Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protections. Systems with NULL page mapping disabled [the default for Windows 8 and after] are not affected.

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero, Ashutosh Mehra of Adobe Systems Inc., WanderingGlitch (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), and KK reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-023

Title: Microsoft Windows Photo Decoder Memory Initialization Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows Photo Decoder. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted JPEG XR (.JXR) image file that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain potentially sensitive information from the target user's system.

Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain potentially sensitive information from the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-029

Title: Microsoft Task Scheduler Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Task Scheduler. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Windows Task Scheduler does not properly validate and enforce impersonation levels. A local user with limited privileges can bypass access control list (ACL) settings and run privileged executables.

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can run privileged executable on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-028

Title: Windows Netlogon Service Lets Remote Authenticated Users Spoof Remote Servers
Version(s): 2003 SP2, 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Netlogon Service. A remote authenticated user can spoof remote servers.
The Windows Netlogon service does not propelry establish secure communication channels. A remote authenticated user on a domain joined system that can monitor network traffic can establish a secure channel connection belonging to a different system and use the channel to obtain session-related information.

Alberto Solino from Core Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can spoof remote servers to obtain session-related information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-027

Title: Microsoft DLL Processing and Windows Text Services Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling flaw in Windows Text Services and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2015-0081]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A remote user can create a specially crafted DLL. When the target user opens a file from the same working directory as the DLL file, the DLL will be loaded and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2015-0096].

[Editor's note: HP reported that MS15-020 issued on March 10, 2015 corrects the vulnerability (CVE-2015-9906) originally identified as CVE-2010-2568 (Alert ID 1024216) in July 2010 and as exploited in the Stuxnet worm.]
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-020

Title: Microsoft Windows Adobe Font Driver Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Windows Adobe Font Driver. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file or HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory allocation error and cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system [CVE-2015-0074].

A remote user can create a specially crafted file or HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain information from system memory [CVE-2015-0087, CVE-2015-0089]. This information can be used in conjunction with a separate vulnerability to bypass Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) security features. 

A remote user can create a specially crafted file or HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [ CVE-2015-0088, CVE-2015-0090, CVE-2015-0091, CVE-2015-0092, CVE-2015-0093]. The code will run with kernel-level privileges.

Mateusz Jurczyk of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory.

A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.

A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-021

Title: Windows VBScript Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows VBScript Scripting Engine. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

An application or Microsoft Office document with an embedded ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" can also trigger this flaw.

Bo Qu of Palo Alto Networks reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-019

Title: Windows Schannel TLS Export Cipher Bug Lets Remote Users Downgrade Session Security
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Schannel. A remote user can downgrade the TLS session security and potentially recover keys.
A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a downgrade to an export-grade cipher suite and then conduct a key factoring attack to recover the target server's RSA private key. The remote user can then determine the TLS master key for that session.

[Editor's note: This is known as a "FREAK" attack.]

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.smacktls.com/#freak

The miTLS Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can downgrade the session security and then conduct a key factoring attack to recover the target server's export-grade RSA private key and to obtain the TLS master key for that session.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-031
https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/3046015

Title: Microsoft Graphics Component TIFF Processing Flaw Discloses Potentially Sensitive System Information
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Graphics Component. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can can create a specially crafted TIFF image that, when loaded by the target user, will disclose portions of system memory.

Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-016

Title: Microsoft Windows SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The software does not properly validate and enforce impersonation levels. A local user can exploit a flaw in processes that use SeAssignPrimaryTokenPrivilege to bypass impersonation-level security checks and gain elevated privileges.

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-015

Title: Microsoft Windows Group Policy Security Configuration Engine Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Policy
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Microsoft Windows Group Policy Security Configuration Engine. A remote user can bypass security policy.
A remote user that can conduct an man-in-the-middle attack can modify domain controller responses to client requests to cause Group Policy settings on the target system to revert to their default setting. This may allow the user to bypass intended security policy.

Luke Jennings reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass Group Policy settings.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-014

Title: Microsoft Windows Group Policy Processing Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code in Certain Cases
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system in certain cases.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the processing of Group Policy data to execute arbitrary code on the target domain-joined system when the target system connects to the remote user's domain controller.

Jeff Schmidt of JAS Global Advisors, Dr. Arnoldo Muller-Molina of simMachines, and the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) reported these vulnerabilities.

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel-Mode Driver. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in 'Win32k.sys' and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2015-0059].

A local user can exploit a flaw in 'Win32k.sys' to gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-0003].

A local user can create a specially crafted application that, when run by the target user, will bypass a security feature in the Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) kernel-mode driver (cng.sys) handling of impersonation levels to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2015-0010].

A local user can exploit an object handling flaw in 'Win32k.sys' to gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-0057].	

A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system

A local user can trigger a cursor object double free memory error in 'win32k.sys' to execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2015-0058].

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero, Udi Yavo, CTO of enSilo, n3phos (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), and Cris Neckar of Divergent Security reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms15-010

Title: Windows Kernel CNG.sys Access Control Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 7, 8.1; possibly other versions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can bypass security controls.
The 'CNG.sys' component does not properly check the impersonation token when the CryptProtectMemory() function captures the logon session ID when encrypting memory. A local user may be able to exploit this in conjunction with a separate vulnerability to gain elevated privileges.

The vendor has been notified.

The original advisory is available at:

https://code.google.com/p/google-security-research/issues/detail?id=128

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can bypass security controls.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://code.google.com/p/google-security-research/issues/detail?id=128

Title: Microsoft Internet Authentication Service/Network Policy Server RADIUS Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 2003 SP2, 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Authentication Service/Network Policy Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted RADIUS username strings to the target Internet Authentication Service (IAS) or Network Policy Server (NPS) to cause the target system to stop responding, preventing RADIUS authentication.

Title: Microsoft Windows WebDAV Kernel-Mode Driver Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows WebDAV Kernel-Mode Driver. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The WebDAV kernel-mode driver (mrxdav.sys) does not properly validate and enforce impersonation levels. A local user can exploit this to gain elevated privileges and intercept WebDAV requests for files from arbitrary servers and redirect those requests to return arbitrary files.

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can intercept WebDAV requests for files from arbitrary servers and redirect those requests to return arbitrary files.

Title: Windows Error Reporting Security Bypass Lets Local Administrative Users Access the Memory of Protected Processes
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Error Reporting. A local administrative user can access the memory of protected processes.
A local administrative user can bypass a Windows Error Reporting security feature to access the memory of a running process protected by "Protected Process Light."

Alex Ionescu of Winsider Seminars & Solutions Inc. and CrowdStrike Inc. reported this vulnerability.

Title: Windows Network Location Awareness Service Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Firewall Policies in Certain Cases
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Network Location Awareness Service. A remote user can bypass some firewall policies in certain cases.
A remote user on the local network can spoof responses to the target user's DNS and LDAP traffic to cause the target user's system to apply a domain profile (for a trusted network) to an untrusted network. This may expose ostensibly restricted services to the untrusted network.

Jonas Vestberg of Senator reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target user's system to apply a domain profile (for a trusted network) to an untrusted network.

Title: Windows User Profile Service Privilege Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows User Profile Service. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a privilege validation flaw in the Windows User Profile Service (ProfSvc) to load registry hives associated with other user accounts and potentially execute arbitrary programs with elevated permissions.

Title: Windows Application Compatibility Cache Permission Check Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Application Compatibility Cache. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted application that will bypass existing permission checks performed during cache modification in the Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility component and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

Title: Microsoft Windows TS WebProxy Component Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Microsoft Windows TS WebProxy component. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Windows does not properly sanitize file paths. A local user, or a remote user that can exploit a separate vulnerability in Internet Explorer, can cause code to be executed at the medium integrity level (i.e., permissions of the target user).

The CLSID of the vulnerable component is: B43A0C1E-B63F-4691-B68F-CD807A45DA01

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

Threat Intel of Symantec reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Title: Windows Kernel Flaw in NtApphelpCacheControl() Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 8.1; possibly other versions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The NtApphelpCacheControl() function in 'ahcache.sys' does not properly validate the caller's impersonation token for administrator privileges. A local user can exploit this to run execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

The vendor was notified on September 30, 2014.

The original advisory is available at:

https://code.google.com/p/google-security-research/issues/detail?id=118

James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Microsoft Graphics Component Discloses Potentially Sensitive System Information
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Graphics Component. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can create a specially crafted JPEG image that, when loaded by the target user, will disclose information to allow the remote user to more reliably predict the memory offsets of specific instructions in a given call stack. When used in conjunction with a separate vulnerability, this may allow the user to bypass Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protections.

Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows VBScript Engine Object Memory Handling Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows VBScript Engine. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Internet Explorer, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This vulnerability can also be triggered when opening a document containing an embedded ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization".

SkyLined (via VeriSign iDefense Labs) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms14-084

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers TrueType Array Index Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font on a network share that, when the target user navigates to the network share via Windows Explorer, will trigger an array index validation flaw and cause the target user's system to stop responding and restart.

Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to stop responding and restart.

Title: Microsoft Input Method Editor (Japanese) Sandbox Bypass Flaw Lets Remote Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Input Method Editor (IME) (Japanese). A remote user can bypass sandbox restrictions to gain elevated privileges.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass the application sandbox and gain elevated privileges.

Title: Windows TCP/IP Stack Object Handling Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows TCP/IP Stack. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a object memory handling flaw during IOCTL processing and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.

The vulnerability resides in tcpip.sys and tcpip6.sys.

Matt Bergin of KoreLogic Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=ccb45a29-edd8-40ce-b71a-85ebbee91141

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=03e80c93-287f-4ec8-af0f-06013d1a561b

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms14-070

Title: Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML) XML Parsing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code

Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs

Title: Microsoft Windows OLE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a Microsoft Office file containing a specially crafted OLE object that, when loaded by the target user, will and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Drew Hintz, Shane Huntley, and Matty Pellegrino of the Google Security Team and Haifei Li and Bing Sun of the McAfee Security Team, and Yu Wang, Bin Wang, and Donghui Zhang of the Baidu Security Team (X-Team) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Microsoft Windows SSL 3.0 Protocol Downgrade Flaw Lets Remote Users Decrypt SSL Traffic
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can decrypt SSL sessions in certain cases.
A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to negotiate a downgrade to SSLv3 instead of a TLS v1.x protocol and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

This protocol vulnerability is referred to as the POODLE ("Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption") vulnerability.

This is a flaw in the protocol rather than in the Microsoft SSL implementation.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.openssl.org/~bodo/ssl-poodle.pdf

Bodo Moller, Thai Duong, and Krzysztof Kotowicz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL sessions.
Solution:
The vendor recommends disabling SSL 3.0 as described in their advisory.

A Microsoft Fix it Solution for Internet Explorer is available at:

https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3009008

[Editor's note: As of February 10, 2015, SSL 3.0 fallback attempts are disabled by default in Internet Explorer 11.]

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/3009008

Title: Windows FAT32 Disk Partition Driver Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows FAT32 Disk Partition Driver. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A physically local user can insert a specially crafted USB drive to trigger a buffer under-allocation flaw in the way the Windows FASTFAT system driver interacts with FAT32 disk partitions and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Flaws Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The 'win32k.sys' driver does not properly handle TrueType fonts. A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The 'win32k.sys' driver does not properly handle objects in memory. A local user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.

CrowdStrike Intelligence Team and FireEye, Inc. reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can create a font file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Windows OLE Object Packager Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows OLE Object Packager. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a Microsoft Office file containing a specially crafted OLE object that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the OLE packager (packager.dll) to download INF files and execute arbitrary code.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited via PowerPoint files.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.isightpartners.com/2014/10/cve-2014-4114/

iSIGHT Partners reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler Integrity Check Error Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges

Description:

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Bugs Lets Local Users Obtain Sensitive Information and Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
Three vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
The system does not properly use window handle thread-owned objects. A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit this flaw in 'win32k.sys' and execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2014-0318].

A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a font processing flaw and execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2014-1819]. Wang Yu of Qihoo 360 reported this vulnerability.

A local user can trigger a kernel pool memory allocation flaw to obtain memory addresses or other sensitive kernel information [CVE-2014-4064]. Ilja Van Sprundel reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can obtain potentially sensitive kernel information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

[Editor's note:  On August 16, 2014 (UTC), the vendor withdrew update 2982791 due to installation issues and recommended that customers uninstall this update. The other update was not affected.]

[Editor's note:  On August 27, 2014, the vendor re-released bulletin MS14-045 to indicate that the 2982791 update has been replaced with the 2993651 update for all supported versions of Microsoft Windows.]

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms14-045

Title: Microsoft Windows Includes Several Invalid Certificates
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user may be able to spoof SSL certificates.
The operating system includes invalid subordinate certificates issued by National Informatics Centre (NIC), which operates subordinate certificate authorities (CAs) under root CAs operated by the Government of India Controller of Certifying Authorities (CCA).

The invalid certificates and thumbprints are:

NIC Certifying Authority:  48 22 82 4e ce 7e d1 45 0c 03 9a a0 77 dc 1f 8a e3 48 9b bf

NIC CA 2011:  c6 79 64 90 cd ee aa b3 1a ed 79 87 52 ec d0 03 e6 86 6c b2

NIC CA 2014:  d2 db f7 18 23 b2 b8 e7 8f 59 58 09 61 50 bf cb 97 cc 38 8a

Unauthorized digital certificates derived from these certificate authorities are being actively used in attacks against various Google and Yahoo domains.

The vulnerability is due to the certificate authority and not the operating system itself.

Adam Langley and the Google Chrome Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to spoof SSL certificates.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, available via automatic update for Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows RT, Windows RT 8.1, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows Phone 8, and Windows Phone 8.1.

The vendor has issued a fix for Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, and Windows Server 2008 R2 systems that use the automatic updater of revoked certificates (see KB2677070).

The vendor has issued a fix for Windows Server 2003 (KB2982792).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/2982792

Title: Microsoft Service Bus AMQP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Service Bus. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a sequence of specially crafted Advanced Message Queuing Protocol (AMQP) messages to the target service to cause the target service to stop processing inbound AMQP messages.

The following DLL versions are affected:

Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll  2.1.30904.0
Microsoft.Cloud.ServiceBus.Client.dll  2.1.30904.0
Microsoft.ServiceBus.Commands.dll  2.0.30904.0
Microsoft.Cloud.ServiceBus.Messaging.dll  2.0.30904.0
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to stop processing inbound AMQP messages.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Microsoft Service Bus 1.1 (Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems SP1):

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=927a4c84-85ac-47ab-ad80-1156b7a68a27

Microsoft Service Bus 1.1 (Windows Server 2012):

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=927a4c84-85ac-47ab-ad80-1156b7a68a27

Microsoft Service Bus 1.1 (Windows Server 2012 R2):

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=927a4c84-85ac-47ab-ad80-1156b7a68a27

A restart is not required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms14-042

Title: Windows Ancillary Function Driver Double Free Memory Error Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Ancillary Function Driver. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted data to the 'afd.sys' driver to trigger a double free memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.

Sebastian Apelt (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain kernel-level privileges on the target system.

Title: Microsoft Windows On-Screen Keyboard Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges

Title: Windows Journal Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Journal. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted Journal file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a parsing error in Windows Journal and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Hamburgers.maccoy at gmail.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML) Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML). A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke MSXML and obtain potentially sensitive information from the target user's system.

Title: Microsoft GDI+ Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft GDI+. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in the Unicode Script Processor (usp10.dll) and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2014-1817].

Scott Bell of Security-Assessment.com reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can create an image file with specially crafted image record types that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2014-1818].

Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google Inc reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms14-036

Title: Windows Kernel 'win32k.sys' Null Dereference Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows 'win32k.sys'. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger a null dereference in 'win32k.sys' in GreSetPaletteEntries() to cause the target system to crash.

Systems with the 16-bit subsystem installed are affected.

Tavis Ormandy reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Microsoft Windows iSCSI Target Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows iSCSI Target. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a large number of specially crafted iSCSI packets on TCP port 3260 to cause the target service to stop responding.

Servers with the iSCSI target role enabled are affected.

An anonymous researcher (via Beyond Security's SecuriTeam Secure Disclosure project) reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to stop responding.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart may be required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms14-028

Title: Microsoft Windows Shell Handler Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows Shell Handler. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted application that invokes the ShellExecute Application Programming Interface (API) function to exploit a flaw in the handling of file associations and execute arbitrary code on the target system with Local System privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain Local System privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows Active Directory Group Policy Preferences Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Active Directory Group Policy preferences. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
On systems that use Active Directory Group Policy preferences to distribute passwords across the domain, and a group policy object (GPO) is configured using Group Policy preferences to set a local administrative password or define credentials to map a network drive, schedule a task, or configure the running context of a service, a local user can retrieve and decrypt the password stored with Group Policy preferences.
Impact': A local user can access a local administrative password to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart may be required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/ms14-025

Title: Microsoft Windows File Handling Component '.bat' and '.cmd' Path Restriction Bypass Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows File Handling Component. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted '.bat' or '.cmd' file that, when loaded by the target user from a network location, will bypass path restrictions and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Stefan Kanthak reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft Security Account Manager Remote Protocol Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Password Guessing Attacks
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1, 2012; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Microsoft Security Account Manager Remote Protocol. A remote user can conduct password guessing attacks.
Windows does not properly validate user lockout states. A remote user with knowledge of a valid username and with network connectivity to a domain controller can connect using the Security Account Manager Remote (SAMR) protocol to conduct a brute forge password guessing attack to determine a target user's password.

Andrew Bartlett of the Samba Team and Catalyst IT reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can conduct password guessing attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object handling flaw in the ' Win32k.sys' kernel-mode device driver and execute arbitrary code on the target system with system privileges [CVE-2014-0300].

A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object handling flaw in the ' Win32k.sys' kernel-mode device driver and obtain portions of kernel memory contents [CVE-2014-0323].

Alexander Chizhov reported the information disclosure vulnerability.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can obtain portions of kernel memory contents.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft Windows IPv6 Stack Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows IPv6 Stack. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 router advertisement packets via a target subnet to cause systems on the target subnet to stop responding.
Impact': A remote user can cause systems on the target subnet to stop responding.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML) Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML). A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user via Internet Explorer, will read files on the target user's local file system or read content of web domains with the privileges of the target user.

FireEye, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

Title: Microsoft Windows Direct2D Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows Direct2D. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a file containing specially crafted specially crafted 2D geometric figures that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Omair (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=43779b6d-d8d5-40b0-a09e-d0009ec0cbcd

Title: (Microsoft Issues Fix for VBScript) Microsoft Internet Explorer Bugs Let Remote Users Obtain Information, Execute Arbitrary Code, and Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Microsoft VBScript Engine is affected by one vulnerability.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-0267, CVE-2014-0269, CVE-2014-0270, CVE-2014-0272, CVE-2014-0273, CVE-2014-0274, CVE-2014-0275, CVE-2014-0276, CVE-2014-0277, CVE-2014-0278, CVE-2014-0279, CVE-2014-0280, CVE-2014-0281, CVE-2014-0283, CVE-2014-0284, CVE-2014-0285, CVE-2014-0286, CVE-2014-0287, CVE-2014-0288, CVE-2014-0289, CVE-2014-0290]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the VBScript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2014-0271]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will access potentially sensitive information from a different domain [CVE-2014-0293].

A remote user may be able to leverage other vulnerabilities and exploit a permission validation flaw to run scripting code with elevated privileges [CVE-2014-0268].

Liang Chen of KeenTeam (@K33nTeam), Code Audit Labs of VulnHunt, James Forshaw of Context Information Security, Simon Zuckerbraun (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Jose A. Vazquez of Yenteasy - Security Research (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), 
Bo Qu of Palo Alto Networks, lokihardt@ASRT (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Scott Bell of Security-Assessment.com, cons0ul and suto (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Sachin Shinde, Peter 'corelanc0d3r' Van Eeckhoutte of Corelan (via HP's Zero Day 
Initiative), Arthur Gerkis (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), and Dieyu dieu deus deva divine dio theos dievas dewa ilu Diyin Ayoo At'eii atua tianzhu Yahweh Zeus Odin El reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from another domain.
Solution:
Microsoft has issued a fix for CVE-2014-0271 for VBScript Engine.

A restart may be required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms14-011

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel-Mode Driver. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) does not properly use window handle thread-owned objects. A local user can run a specially crafted application to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.

xiaohong shi of Qihoo reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft Local Remote Procedure Call (LRPC) Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Local Remote Procedure Call (LRPC). A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can spoof an LRPC server and send a specially crafted LPC port message to trigger a stack overflow on the target LRPC client to execute arbitrary code on the target system with administrative privileges.

Renguang Yuan of Qihoo reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain administrative privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a flaw in 'win32k.sys' and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

A memory corruption flaw may occur [CVE-2013-3899]. Renguang Yuan of Qihoo reported this vulnerability.

A use-after-free may occur [CVE-2013-3902]. 

A TrueType font parsing error may occur [CVE-2013-3903]. Ling Chuan Lee of F13 Laboratory reported this vulnerability.

A double-fetch memory flaw may occur in the Windows audio port-class driver (portcls.sys) [CVE-2013-3907].

An integer overflow may occur [CVE-2013-5058]. Nicolas Economou of Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Title: Microsoft Scripting Runtime Object Library Use-After-Free Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Scripting Runtime Object Library. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Windows Script 5.6, 5.7, and 5.8 is affected.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart may be required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-099

Title: Microsoft Windows WinVerifyTrust Verification Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
The WinVerifyTrust function does not properly verify Windows Authenticode signatures for portable executable (PE) files. A remote user can create a specially crafted PE file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited in targeted cases.

Kingsoft Internet Security Center @ Kingsoft Internet Security Software Co. Ltd reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a PE file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft Windows Includes An Invalid Certificate
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, 2012 R2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user may be able to spoof SSL certificates.
The operating system includes an invalid subordinate certificate issued by Directorate General of the Treasury (DG Tresor), subordinate to the Government of France CA (ANSSI).

The invalid certificate and its thumbprint is:

AC DG Tresor SSL:  5c e3 39 46 5f 41 a1 e4 23 14 9f 65 54 40 95 40 4d e6 eb e2

Unauthorized digital certificates derived from this certificate authority are being actively used in attacks against various Google domains.

The vulnerability is due to the certificate authority and not the operating system itself.

Adam Langley and the Google Chrome Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to spoof SSL certificates.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, available via automatic update for Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2012 R2, and Windows Phone 8.

The vendor has issued a fix for Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, and Windows Server 2008 R2 systems that use the automatic updater of revoked certificates (see KB2677070).

For Windows XP or Windows Server 2003, the vendor recommends applying update 2917500).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/advisory/2916652

Title: Windows Kernel Bug in IsHandleEntrySecure() Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Version(s): Windows 2008; possibly other versions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger a null pointer dereference in the IsHandleEntrySecure() function and cause the target system to crash.

The original advisory is available at:

http://pastebin.com/we0ZSQC0

@sixtyvividtails reported this vulnerability.

Title: Windows NDPROXY Driver Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system

Description:

A local user can trigger a flaw in the 'NDProxy.sys' kernel driver to execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited in limited situations.

Title: Microsoft GDI+ Windows Write File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 8.1, 2012, RT, RT 8.1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft GDI+. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a Windows Write (.wri) file containing a specially crafted image that, when loaded by the target user via WordPad, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Title: Microsoft Windows Memory Corruption Error in Graphics Component Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TIFF image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in a Microsoft graphics component and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

Microsoft Office is also affected:

Microsoft Office 2003 Service Pack 3
Microsoft Office 2007 Service Pack 3
Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 1 (32-bit editions)
Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (32-bit editions)
Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 1 (64-bit editions)
Microsoft Office 2010 Service Pack 2 (64-bit editions)
Microsoft Office Compatibility Pack Service Pack 3

Microsoft Lync is also affected:

Microsoft Lync 2010 (32-bit)
Microsoft Lync 2010 (64-bit)
Microsoft Lync 2010 Attendee
Microsoft Lync 2013 (32-bit)
Microsoft Lync Basic 2013 (32-bit)
Microsoft Lync 2013 (64-bit)
Microsoft Lync Basic 2013 (64-bit)

Haifei Li of McAfee Labs IPS Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a TIFF image file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:
