Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted OpenType font file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-3128]. An anonymous researcher (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.

A physically local user can insert a specially crafted USB device to trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-3200]. Andy Davis of NCC Group and Lucas Bouillot of ANSSI reported this vulnerability.

A local user can trigger a use-after-free memory handling error in 'win32k.sys' to execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-3879].

A local user can create a specially crafted application that, when run by the target user, will exploit a flaw in the Windows App Container to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2013-3880].

A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a NULL page access flaw and execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-3881]. Seth Gibson and Dan Zentner of Endgame reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-3894]. ZombiE (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A local user can obtain kernel-level privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor advisory.

A restart is required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-081

Title: Windows Common Control Library Memory Allocation Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP x64 SP2, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Common Control Library. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to an ASP.NET application that uses the DSA_InsertItem() function to trigger a memory allocation error in the common control library ('Comctl32.dll') and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Theme File. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a Windows theme file containing a specially crafted Windows screensaver that, when applied by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Eduardo Prado (via VeriSign iDefense Labs) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a theme file that, when applied by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=22358688-e3dc-4493-a145-75c3fbb14af1

Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=113a6455-5b09-4990-8c99-cb5fd403b636

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=ab3516a2-b3e6-4378-a39b-37482658b87c

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Memory Errors Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:

A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger memory errors and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

Title: Windows Service Control Manager Double Free Memory Error Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Service Control Manager. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted application that will trigger a double free memory error in the Service Control Manager (SCM) and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Microsoft OLE Memory Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft OLE. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a file containing a specially crafted Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) object that, when loaded by the target user with an application that processes OLE objects, will trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

G. Geshev (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:

Title: Windows TCP/IP Stack ICMPv6 Memory Allocation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows TCP/IP Stack. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted ICMPv6 packets to trigger a memory allocation error and cause the target system to stop responding. A restart is required to return the system to normal operations.

Basil Gabriel of Symantec reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to stop responding.

Title: Windows NAT Driver ICMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service

Title: Windows Kernel Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Bypass ALSR
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) security feature.
A local user can trigger a memory corruption flaw in the NT Virtual DOS Machine (NTVDM) to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2013-3196, CVE-2013-3197, CVE-2013-3198].

A local user can bypass the ASLR security feature to load malicious code [CVE-2013-2556].

VUPEN Security (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported the ASLR bypass vulnerability. Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google Inc reported the memory corruption vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Microsoft Windows Unicode Scripts Processor Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows Unicode Scripts Processor. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create HTML or a document containing specially crafted OpenType fonts that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption flaw in the Unicode Script Processor (USP10.DLL) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Bob Clary of Mozilla reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=779bb733-a1b5-4dd0-a6fa-5de0f33aecc7

Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=93b9936f-eb56-4327-b00b-7b259b9a55e6

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

Title: Windows Phone PEAP-MS-CHAPv2 Authentication Protocol Weakness May Let Remote Users Obtain Authentication Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the PEAP-MS-CHAPv2 authentication protocol used by Windows Phone. A remote user can obtain authentication information.
The Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol with Microsoft Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol version 2 (PEAP-MS-CHAPv2) Wi-Fi authentication protocol used by Windows Phones for WPA2 wireless authentication contains a known cryptographic weakness. A remote user can exploit this weakness to obtain the target user's domain credentials and use those credentials to access network resources acting as the target user.

The vulnerability resides in the protocol itself and not in the Microsoft implementation of the protocol.
Impact': A remote user can obtain the target user's domain credentials and use those credentials to access network resources acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vulnerability resides in the protocol itself and not in the vendor's implementation of the protocol. The vendor has described configuration changes for the wireless access points and Windows Phone 8 devices to address the protocol vulnerability.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/advisory/2876146

Title: Windows Media Format Runtime Parsing Flaw in WMV Video Decoder Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Media Format Runtime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted media file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a parsing error in the WMV video decoder and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

An anonymous researcher (via HP's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

[Editor's note: On August 13, 2013, the vendor updated their advisory to re-release the 2803821 update for Windows 7 and Windows 2008 R2 and advised users of Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 to install the re-released update.]

Title: Microsoft Windows GDI+ TrueType Font Parsing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows GDI+. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType Fonts (TTF) file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a parsing error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with kernel-level privileges.

Ling Chuan Lee and Lee Yee Chan of F13 Laboratory reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-054

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType Fonts (TTF) file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a parsing error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-3129]. The code will run with kernel-level privileges.

A local user can trigger a memory allocation error to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-1300].

A local user can trigger a object dereference error to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-1340].

A local user can trigger a memory error to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-1345].

A local user can trigger a memory error to obtain information and potentially gain kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-3167].

A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in 'win32k.sys' to cause the system to stop responding [CVE-2013-3172].

A local user can trigger a buffer overwrite to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-3173].

Jon Butler and Nils of MWR Labs (via HP's Zero Day Initiative), Alexandar Chizhov of Dr.Web, an anonymous researcher (via HP's Zero Day Initiative, Ling Chuan Lee and Lee Yee Chan of F13 Laboratory, Yinliang from Tencent PC Manager, Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google Inc, and Wen Yujie and Guo Pengfei of Qihoo 360 Security Center reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system with kernel-level privileges.

A local user can obtain kernel-level privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause the system to stop responding.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Bugs Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
Three vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the DirectX graphics kernel subsystem (dxgkrnl.sys) in the handling of memory objects to execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-1332].

Gynvael Coldwind and Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google Inc reported this vulnerability.

A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in 'win32k.sys' in the handling of memory objects to execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-1333].

Qihoo 360 Security Center reported this vulnerability.

A local user can trigger an object handling flaw in 'win32k.sys' to execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2013-1334].

An anonymous researcher (via iDefense VCP) reported this vulnerability.

Title: Windows HTTP Stack Header Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 8, Server 2012
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows HTTP Stack. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP header to cause the target the HTTP protocol stack (HTTP.sys) to enter an infinite loop.

Both clients and servers are affected.

Marek Kroemeke, 22733db72ab3ed94b5f8a1ffcde850251fe6f466, and AKAT-1 reported this vulnerability (via HP's Zero Day Initiative).
Impact': A remote user can cause the system to enter an infinite loop.
Solution:

Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2; and prior service packs

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Bugs Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A local user can exploit a memory object allocation race condition in 'Win32k.sys' to gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-1283]. Gynvael Coldwind and Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google reported this vulnerability.

A user can create a specially crafted OpenType font file that, when processed by the target system, will cause the target system to stop responding and restart [CVE-2013-1291]. Wang Yu reported this vulnerability.

A local user can exploit a memory object allocation race condition in 'Win32k.sys' to gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-1292]. Gynvael Coldwind and Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google reported this vulnerability.

A local user can mount a specially crafted NTFS volume to exploit a memory object allocation error in the NTFS kernel-mode driver and gain kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-1293]. Gynvael Coldwind and Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

[Editor's note: On April 23, 2012, the vendor re-issued MS13-036 to replace the 2823324 update with the 2840149 update. The original version may cause errors on Windows 7 and 2008 when certain third-party software is installed.]

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-036

Title: Windows USB Driver Memory Error Lets Physically Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A physically local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A physically local user can insert a specially crafted USB device to trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges.

Title: Windows Kernel Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit an object memory handling race condition to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-1278, CVE-2013-1279].

A local user can exploit a kernel reference count flaw to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2013-1280].

Gynvael Coldwind and Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google Inc reported two of these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=9100bf70-8723-4635-9b78-f7c3048a950f

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to exploit race conditions in 'win32k.sys' and gain System level privileges.

The known attack vectors are blocked in Windows 8, 2012, and RT.

Mateusz "j00ru" Jurczyk of Google Inc, Gynvael Coldwind of Google Inc, and Tencent Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Windows OLE Automation Memory Allocation Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft OLE Automation. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted RTF file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory allocation error in Microsoft Windows Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) Automation and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via HP's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can create an RTF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=3a8ddbab-5999-48b7-9de8-423954f345b6

A restart is required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-020

Title: Windows TCP/IP Stack Lets Remote Users Downgrade SSL/TLS Sessions
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows TCP/IP Stack. A remote user can bypass SSL/TLS security restrictions.
A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject specially crafted data into an SSL/TLS session to cause the SSLv3 or TLS session to be silently downgraded to a SSLv2 session.

Kenichiro Katayama reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass SSL/TLS security restrictions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The Windows kernel does not properly handles window broadcast messages. A local user can run a specially crafted application to execute arbitrary code in the context of a higher Integrity Level (IL) process.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Windows Print Spooler Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Print Spooler. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted print job to trigger a flaw in the print spooler service and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with system privileges.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with system privileges.

Title: Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML) XML Parsing Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer truncation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-0006]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an XSLT parsing flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-0007].  The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Nicolas Gregoire of Agarri reported this vulnerability via VeriSign iDefense Labs.

Non-Microsoft web applications and services that use the MSXML library for parsing XML may also be affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-002

Title: Microsoft Windows Includes Some Invalid TURKTRUST Certificates
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user may be able to spoof sites.
The operating system includes some invalid certificates. The vulnerability is due to the invalid certificates and not the operating system itself.

TURKTRUST Inc. incorrectly created two subsidiary certificate authorities (CAs) ('*.EGO.GOV.TR' and 'e-islem.kktcmerkezbankasi.org') as end-entity certs and without CRL or OCSP extensions. The '*.EGO.GOV.TR' subsidiary CA was then used to issue a fraudulent digital certificate for '*.google.com'. 

A fraudulent digital certificate has been actively used in attacks against several Google web domains.

Windows Phone 8 is also affected.

Adam Langley and the Google Chrome Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to spoof sites.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix that revokes the affected CA certificates, available at:

http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2798897

Systems configured with the automatic updater of revoked certificates do not need to apply a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/advisory/2798897

Title: Windows IP-HTTPS Certificate Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows IP-HTTPS. A remote user can bypass security restrictions.
A remote user can present a previously valid but currently revoked certificate to a target application or service via IP over HTTPS (IP-HTTPS) to gain access to the application or service.

The certificate must have been issued from the domain for IP-HTTPS server authentication.

Systems configured for DirectAccess may be affected.
Impact': A remote user can bypass certificate validation checks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems:

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Font Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a file with a specially crafted OpenType font that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-2556]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A remote user can create a file with a specially crafted TrueType font that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-4786]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Eetu Luodemaa and Joni Vahamaki of Documill reported the OpenType vulnerability via the Chromium Security Rewards Program.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows File Handling Component Memory Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows File Handling Component. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file name or folder name that, when browsed by the target user, will trigger a memory allocation error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Lucas Apa of IOActive reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file name or folder name that, when viewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Windows Kernel Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Obtain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012, RT; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities was reported in the Windows Kernel. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a parsing error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-2897]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Eetu Luodemaa and Joni Vahamaki of Documill (via the Chromium Security Rewards Program) reported this vulnerability.

A local user can trigger a use-after-free memory error in the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges [CVE-2012-2530, CVE-2012-2553].

Matthew Jurczyk of Google Inc reported one of these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows Shell Briefcase Integer Overflow and Underflow Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1, 8, 2012; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Shell. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will trigger an integer underflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1527]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A remote user can create a specially crafted briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1528]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Tal Zeltzer reported these vulnerabilities via VeriSign iDefense Labs.
Impact': A remote user can create a briefcase that, when opened by the target user via Windows Explorer, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Windows Kernel Integer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs

Title: Microsoft Kerberos Null Pointer Dereference Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Kerberos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the target Kerberos server to stop responding and restart.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to stop responding and restart.
Solution:

Title: Windows Phone Certificate Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Spoof Secure E-mail Servers
Version(s): Windows Phone 7
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Phone 7. A remote user can spoof secure e-mail servers in certain cases.
The software does not validate Common Name (CN) values of mail server SSL certificates when sending or retrieving email via POP3, IMAP, and SMTP.

A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack between the target e-mail server and the target phone device can spoof the secure e-mail server to access the encrypted session.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/389795
Impact': A remote user can spoof secure e-mail servers in certain cases.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix.

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can trigger a use-after-free memory error in 'Win32k.sys' to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges.

Matthew Jurczyk of Google Inc reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain kernel privileges on the target system.

Title: Windows Print Spooler Remote Administration Protocol Format String and Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Print Spooler. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a sequence of specially crafted Remote Administration Protocol (RAP) packets to cause the target service to stop responding [CVE-2012-1850].

A remote user can return a specially crafted response to the target print spooler to trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1851].

A remote user can send a sequence of specially crafted RAP packets to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1852]. The code will run with System privileges.

A remote user can send a sequence of specially crafted RAP packets to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2012-1853]. The code will run with System privileges.

Yamata Li of Palo Alto Networks reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows Schannel Lets Remote Users Decrypt TLS Traffic
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Schannel. A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases.
A remote user with the ability to monitor encrypted sessions can issue an HTTP response to a target user's connected web browser to cause the target user's browser to send several requests within a single TLS session to a third party HTTPS site where cookie-based authentication has previously occurred. The remote user monitoring the TLS session can decrypt portions of the HTTPS traffic.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS protocol itself. Other operating systems are also affected.

The vulnerability occurs when using a Cipher-Block Chaining (CBC) based cryptographic algorithm.
Impact': A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=8324496f-aca4-4a86-833d-c22341e71cd3

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Bugs Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) does not properly handle specific keyboard layouts [CVE-2012-1890]. A local user can run a specially crafted program to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges.

Nicolas Economou of Core Security Technologies and Qihoo 360 Security Center reported this vulnerability.

The the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) does not properly validate callback parameters when creating a hook procedure [CVE-2012-1893]. A local user can exploit this execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges.

Lufeng Li (via Secunia Research) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows Shell Command Injection Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Shell. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially named file or directory that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary commands on the target system. The commands will run with the privileges of the target user.

Adi Cohen of IBM Security Systems - Application Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file or directory that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Microsoft Data Access Components (MDAC) ADO Cachesize Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2.8 SP1, 2.8 SP2; also Windows Data Access Components 6.0 on some operating systems
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Data Access Components (MDAC). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an ActiveX Data Objects Cachesize heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms12-045

Title: Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML) Object Access Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft XML Core Services (MSXML). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object access memory error in MSXML and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Microsoft Office 2003 SP3, 2007 SP2, and 2007 SP3 are also affected.

Google Security Team and Qihoo 360 Security Center reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

The Microsoft advisories are available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms12-043
http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/advisory/2719615

Title: Windows Kernel Bug in User Mode Scheduler Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, 7 SP1 (for x64), 2008 R2 SP1 (for x64); and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to exploit Windows User Mode Scheduler (UMS) to execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

[Editor's note: Xen is also affected.]

Rafal Wojtczuk of Bromium and Jan Beulich of SUSE reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Driver Bugs Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a name handling flaw in 'win32k.sys' and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges [CVE-2012-1864, CVE-2012-1865, CVE-2012-1866]. Tarjei Mandt of Azimuth Security reported these vulnerabilities.

A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a TrueType font loading flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges [CVE-2012-1867]. Mateusz 'j00ru' Jurczyk of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.

A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a race condition in 'win32k.sys' and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges [CVE-2012-1868].
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft Windows Includes Some Invalid Certificates
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user may be able to spoof code signing signatures.
The operating system includes some invalid intermediate certificates. The invalid certificates and their thumbprints are:

Microsoft Enforced Licensing Intermediate PCA:  2a 83 e9 02 05 91 a5 5f c6 dd ad 3f b1 02 79 4c 52 b2 4e 70

Microsoft Enforced Licensing Intermediate PCA:  3a 85 00 44 d8 a1 95 cd 40 1a 68 0c 01 2c b0 a3 b5 f8 dc 08

Microsoft Enforced Licensing Registration Authority CA (SHA1):  fa 66 60 a9 4a b4 5f 6a 88 c0 d7 87 4d 89 a8 63 d7 4d ee 97

The vulnerability is due to the certificate authorities and not the operating system itself.

Unauthorized digital certificates derived from these certificate authorities are being actively used in attacks.

Windows Mobile 6.x and Windows Phone 7 and 7.5 are also affected.
Impact': A remote user may be able to spoof code signing signatures.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (KB2718704), available via automatic update.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/advisory/2718704

Title: Windows TCP/IP Stack Lets Remote Users Bypass the Firewall and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): Vista SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows TCP/IP Stack. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user on the local network can bypass the firewall in certain cases.
In certain cases, Windows Firewall does not properly filter outbound broadcast packets with an outbound firewall rule applied [CVE-2012-0174]. A remote user on the local network can bypass the firewall. Bojan Zdrnja of INFIGO IS reported this vulnerability.

The TCP/IP stack does not properly handle the binding of an IPv6 address to a local interface [CVE-2012-0179]. A local user can exploit this to trigger a double free memory error and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user on the local network can bypass the firewall in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft Windows Partition Manager Memory Allocation Error Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause two or more processes or threads to call Plug and Play (PnP) Configuration Manager functions at the same time and trigger a memory allocation error.

Title: Windows OS Lets Remote Users Cause Arbitrary Code to Be Executed and Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows operating system. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-3402, CVE-2012-0159]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

A local user can trigger a windows and messages handling flaw in the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) to execute arbitrary code in the context of another process [CVE-2012-0180].

A local user can trigger a keyboard layout file processing error in the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) to execute arbitrary code in the context of another process [CVE-2012-0181].

A local user can trigger a scrollbar calculation flaw in the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) to execute arbitrary code in the context of another process [CVE-2012-1848].

Alin Rad Pop (via Tipping Point's Zero Day Initiative), Tarjei Mandt of Azimuth Security, Nicolas Economou of Core Security Technologies, Geoff McDonald of Symantec, and h4ckmp reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms12-034

Title: Microsoft GDI+ Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft GDI+. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted EMF file that, when loaded by the target user (via a Microsoft Office file, for example), will trigger a memory corruptiion error [CVE-2012-0165] or heap overflow [CVE-2012-0167] and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Microsoft Office is affected.

An anonymous researcher reported these vulnerabilities via iDefense.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

A restart is required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms12-034

Title: Windows Win32k.sys Memory Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Version(s): XP SP3
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a memory error in the CreateWindowEx() function and cause the target system to crash.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/18819/

Lufeng Li of Neusoft Corporation reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Windows Authenticode Signature Verification Can Be Bypassed By Remote or Local Users
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Authenticode Signature Verification. A remote user can bypass signature verification.
A remote user can modify a valid and signed PE file that, when verified by the target user, will bypass the WinVerifyTrust signature verification and execute arbitrary code.

Robert Zacek and Igor Glucksmann of Avast Software reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Windows Authenticode Signature Verification.

Title: Windows Kernel PostMessage() Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to exploit a flaw in the PostMessage() function and cause the Windows kernel-mode driver (win32k.sys) to execute arbitrary code. The code will run with kernel level privileges.

Title: Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP Pro x64 SP2, 2003 and 2003 x64 SP2, Vista x64 SP2, 2008 x64 SP2, 7 x64 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Ancillary Function Driver. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to exploit a flaw in AfdPoll and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel privileges [CVE-2012-0148].

A local user can run a specially crafted program to exploit a flaw in 'afd.sys' and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel privileges [CVE-2012-0149].

Title: Windows XP Indeo Codec DLL Loading Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows XP Indeo Codec. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted DLL file on a remote share (e.g., WebDAV, SMB share). When the target user opens a media file on that remote share, the system may load the remote user's DLL instead of the intended DLL and execute arbitrary code. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This type of exploit is also known as "binary planting" or "DLL preloading".

Windows XP Professional x64 Edition SP2 is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can may be able to cause a target application to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fix:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=32e5c9ad-b610-4afb-b6f0-bb0b5fbdd1f6

A restart may be required.

The Microsoft advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms12-014

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 2008 SP2, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Color Control Panel. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted DLL file on a remote share (e.g., WebDAV, SMB share). When the target user opens a '.icm' or '.icc' file on that remote share, the system may load the remote user's DLL instead of the intended DLL and execute arbitrary code. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This type of exploit is also known as "binary planting" or "DLL preloading".
Impact': A remote user can may be able to cause a target application to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Windows C Runtime Library Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows C Runtime.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted media file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in 'msvcrt.dll' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Any application that uses 'msvcrt.dll' is affected.

Alexander Gavrun (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a media file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft Windows ClickOnce Feature Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
ClickOnce application file types are not included in the Windows Packager unsafe file type list. As a result, a remote user can embed ClickOnce applications into Microsoft Office documents.

A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when opened by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via Beyond Security's SecuriTeam Secure Disclosure program.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=1bcb1d1e-9261-4a36-9256-90d3df9bd4fb

Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2:

Title: Windows Client-Server Run-time Subsystem Unicode Processing Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Client-Server Run-time Subsystem. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The software does not properly processes a sequence of specially crafted Unicode characters. A local user can run specially crafted code to access memory that has not been properly initialized and execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

Systems that run with a multi-byte language system locale (e.g., Chinese, Japanese, or Korean) are affected.

Kang Wu of Shenzhen Jowto Research Dep reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

Title: Windows Object Packager Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Object Packager. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a file with a specially crafted embedded packaged object that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code located on a network share, a UNC, or WebDAV location. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Title: Windows Kernel Lets Local Users Bypass the SafeSEH Security Feature
Version(s): XP Pro x64 SP2, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can bypass the SafeSEH security feature.
The Windows kernel does not properly load a structured exception handling table into the "Load Configuration" PE header during binary execution. A local user can exploit this to bypass the SafeSEH security feature and potentially exploit other vulnerabilities on the target system.

Joshua J. Drake of VeriSign iDefense Labs repored this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can bypass the SafeSEH security feature.

Title: Windows Win32k.sys GDI Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the the Windows kernel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user via Safari (or possibly other applications), will trigger a memory corruption error and cause the target user's operating system to execute arbitrary code.

The vulnerability resides in NtGdiDrawStream().

A specially crafted IFRAME tag height value can trigger the crash.

A demonstration exploit is provided:

<iframe height='18082563'></iframe> 

The vendor has been notified.

The original advisory is available at:

https://twitter.com/#!/w3bd3vil/status/148454992989261824

webDEViL reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Windows OLE Processing Error Lets Remote Users Cause Arbitary Code to Be Executed on the Target User's System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows Object Linking and Embedding (OLE).  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
The system does not properly process OLE objects in memory. A remote user can create a file containing a specially crafted OLE object that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A local user can run a specially crafted application to send an interprocess device event message to a higher-integrity process and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.

Title: Windows Win32k.sys Keyboard Layout Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can trigger a flaw in NtUserLoadKeyboardLayoutEx() and cause the target system to crash.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/18140

instruder reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Windows Win32k.sys Kernel-Mode Drivers Array Index Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Win32k.sys. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Windows kernel-mode drivers do not properly validate an array index when loading a TrueType font file. A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target system to stop responding and restart.

Will Dorman of the CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target kernel to stop responding and restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Windows TCP/IP Stack Integer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows TCP/IP Stack. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a continuous flow of specially crafted UDP packets to a closed port on the target system to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with kernel level privileges.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.
Solution:

Title: Microsoft Windows TrueType Font Parsing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with kernel level privileges.

The vulnerability resides in the Win32k.sys kernel driver in the parsing of TrueType fonts.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited by the Duqu malware.

CrySyS Lab reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Title: Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows Ancillary Function Driver. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The Ancillary Function Driver (afd.sys) does not properly validate user mode data. A local user can run a specially crafted application to execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

Bo Zhou of National University of Defense Technology reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Memory Corruption Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a null pointer dereference in Win32k.sys and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on 32-bit operating systems [CVE-2011-1985].

A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when processed by the target user via the Windows Explorer Details and Previews pane, will cause the target system to stop responding and restart [CVE-2011-2002].

A remote user can create a specially crafted '.fon' font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-2003].

A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a use-after-free memory error in Win32k.sys and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-2011].

Andrei Lutas of BitDefender, Tarjei Mandt of Norman, Maik Wellmann, and Will Dorman of the CERT/CC reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A local user can gain kernel level privileges on the target system.

A local user can cause the target system to stop responding and restart.
Solution:

Title: Microsoft Active Accessibility Component DLL Loading Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Active Accessibility. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted DLL file in a directory or on a remote share (e.g., WebDAV, SMB share). When the file is loaded by the target user, the Microsoft Active Accessibility component may load the remote user's DLL instead of the intended DLL and execute arbitrary code. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This type of exploit is also known as "binary planting" or "DLL preloading".
Impact': A remote user may be able to cause a target application to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:

Title: Microsoft Windows SSL/TLS Protocol Flaw Lets Remote Users Decryption Sessions
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows SSL/TLS stack. A remote user can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions in certain cases.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on an HTTPS connection can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions.

The vulnerability resides in the SSL 3.0 and TLS 1.0 specifications when using a Cipher-Block Chaining (CBC) based cryptographic algorithm.

The TLS 1.1 and 1.2 protocols are not affected.

Thai Duong and Juliano Rizzo reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL/TLS sessions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/advisory/2588513

Title: Microsoft Windows Components DLL Loading Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows Components. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Some components of Microsoft Windows may pass an insufficiently qualified path when loading an external library. A remote user can exploit this by creating a specially crafted DLL file on a remote share (e.g., WebDAV, SMB share). When the target user loads a rich text format file (.rtf), text file (.txt), or Word document (.doc), the system may load the remote user's DLL instead of the intended DLL and execute arbitrary code. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This type of exploit is also known as "binary planting" or "DLL preloading".

The Display Panning CPL Extension (deskpan.dll), Microsoft EAPHost Authenticator Service, Microsoft Management Console (MMC), Folder Redirection, the Japanese Input Method Editor (IME), and HyperTerminal components are affected.
Impact': A remote user can may be able to cause the operating system to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Title: Microsoft Windows Internet Name Service (WINS) Input Validation Flaw in ECommEndDlg() Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows Internet Name Service (WINS). A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can send a sequence of specially crafted packets to the WINS server via the loopback interface to execute arbitrary code on the target system with Local System privileges.

The vulnerability resides in the ECommEndDlg() function.

Title: Windows 2008 R1 CSRSS Null Pointer Dereference Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows 2008 CSRSS. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local unprivileged user can execute code to trigger a null pointer dereference in 'csrss.exe' cause the target system to crash.

Windows 2008 R2 is not affected.

The vendor was notified on July 15, 2010.

Aliz 'Randomdude' reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Windows Script Host DLL Loading Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Windows Script Host v5.6
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Script Host. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted DLL file in a directory or on a remote share (e.g., WebDAV, SMB share). When the target application (wscript.exe) is loaded by the target user, the application may load the remote user's DLL instead of the intended DLL and execute arbitrary code. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This type of exploit is also known as "binary planting" or "DLL preloading".

The vendor was notified on August 19, 2011.

Juan Manuel Garcia of Cybsec reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to cause a target application to execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Microsoft Windows DHCPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Denial of Service to RPC Services
Version(s): Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 32 bit & 64 bit
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows RPC. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can return a specially crafted DHCPv6 response to the requesting target system to cause the target RPC service to fail.

A specially crafted Domain Search List option can trigger this flaw.

The vendor was notified on July 8, 2011.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.barracudalabs.com/wordpress/index.php/2011/08/16/malformed-dhcpv6-packets-cause-rpc-to-become-unresponsive/

Michael Burgbacher and Thomas Unterleitner of Barracuda Networks AG reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause RPC services to become unavailable.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Windows Kernel File Metadata Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Kernel. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The kernel does not properly parse metadata information in files. A remote user can create a specially crafted file. When the target user visits a network share containing the file, the target user's system will restart.

Impact': A remote user can cause the target user's system to restart.

Title: Windows TCP/IP Stack Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows TCP/IP Stack. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted ICMP message to cause the target system to stop responding and automatically restart [CVE-2011-1871].

A remote user can send a specially crafted URL to a web service that uses URL-based QoS to cause the target system to stop responding and automatically restart [CVE-2011-1965].
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to stop responding and automatically restart.
Solution:

Title: Windows Client-Server Run-time Subsystem 'Winsrv.dll' Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Windows Client-Server Run-time Subsystem.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
'Winsrv.dll' does not properly validate permissions when a lower-integrity process communicates a device event message to a higher-integrity process. A local user can exploit this to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with the privileges of the target process, which may be a privileged process.

Alex Ionescu of Winsider Seminars & Solutions Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Description:

A local user can supply specially crafted data to the NDISTAPI driver (NDISTAPI.sys) to execute arbitrary code on the target system with elevated privileges.

Title: Microsoft Data Access Components Insecure Library Loading Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Data Access Components (MDAC).  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file located in the same network directory as a specially crafted library file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the Windows Data Access Tracing component and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
Impact': A remote user can create a file in a certain location that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:

Title: Windows Client-Server Run-time Subsystem SrvGetConsoleTitle() Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Version(s): XP SP3; possibly other versions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Windows Client-Server Run-time Subsystem (CSRSS). A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the SrvGetConsoleTitle() function to cause the target system to crash.

The original advisory is available at:

http://j00ru.vexillium.org/?p=971
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Windows Client-Server Run-time Subsystem Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Client-Server Run-time Subsystem. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can run a specially crafted program that exploits a flaw in the AllocConsole command to obtain the object handle to extra console objects that have been orphaned by another process and execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel privileges [CVE-2011-1281].

A local user can run a specially crafted program that exploits a flaw in the SrvSetConsoleLocalEUDC command to trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel privileges [CVE-2011-1282].

A local user can run a specially crafted program that exploits an array index validation flaw in the SrvSetConsoleNumberOfCommand command to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges [CVE-2011-1283].

A local user can run a specially crafted program that exploits a flaw in the SrvWriteConsoleOutput command to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel privileges [CVE-2011-1284].

A local user can run a specially crafted program that exploits a flaw in the SrvWriteConsoleOutputString command to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel privileges [CVE-2011-1870].

Matthew 'j00ru' Jurczyk of Hispasec Virustotal reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain kernel mode privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:

Windows XP Service Pack 3:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=425C705E-94F2-4FA6-9DF2-DC71897215FA

Title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): XP SP3, 2003 SP2, Vista SP2, 2008 SP2, 7 SP1, 2008 R2 SP1; and prior service packs
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel-mode Driver (win32k.sys). A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can read kernel memory.
A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a use-after-free on kernel-mode driver objects to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-1874, CVE-2011-1875, CVE-2011-1876, CVE-2011-1877, CVE-2011-1878, CVE-2011-1879, CVE-2011-1882, CVE-2011-1883, CVE-2011-1884].

A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a null-pointer dereference and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-1880, CVE-2011-1881, CVE-2011-1885, CVE-2011-1887, CVE-2011-1888].

Tarjei Mandt of Norman reported these privilege escalation vulnerabilities.

A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a null-pointer dereference and read kernel memory contents, including the Security Account Manager (SAM) database [CVE-2011-1886].

Mr. Liang Yin, Prof. Sihan Qing and Weiping Wen, and Mr. Husheng Zhou, Department of Information Security, Beijing University, reported this information disclosure vulnerability.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can read kernel memory.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes:
